meanings.definition: A large organized group of soldiers trained for war.
meanings.sent1: The armies marched in formation towards the enemy.
meanings.sent2: The country's armies defended its borders from invasion.
meanings.sent3: The armies decided to have a dance-off instead of a battle.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was an army of one, ready to face any challenge.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the marching armies echoed through the valley.

meanings.definition: A large number of people or things.
meanings.sent1: The armies of shoppers flooded the mall on Black Friday.
meanings.sent2: There were armies of ants marching in a straight line.
meanings.sent3: The armies of clouds in the sky looked like fluffy cotton candy.
meanings.sent4: The armies of books on the shelves seemed to stretch on forever.
meanings.sent5: The armies of stars twinkled brightly in the night sky.
